title: Unable to show weather info for this location - Pixel 5
content:
I have the same issue as seen on a similar post earlier this year - the weather displays accurately for my location in the "At a Glance" homescreen widget. However, when I click on the icon, I get the message "Unable to show weather info for this location." When I click in the "Search places" bar, I see an empty slot labeled "Your location", but it's blank. Normally it would list my actual location, London UK. 

This is not affecting Assistant features. When I ask, "What's the weather?" it is able to tell me the London weather.

I have done many things to try to fix this:
Reset App Permissions
Factor Reset Device
Check that Location is on and enabled for Google and Pixel Maps
Checked Roaming settings

Any thoughts on what could be causing this would be greatly appreciated.

title: Buggy apps
content:
While I'm mostly happy with this phone I'm beginning to get frustrated by buggy built in app issues. Managed to fix the issues with texts that existed from the start, but now I'm finding the Do Not Disturb feature doesn't accurately work regardless of permissions and settings, nor does the routine for my alarm. DND has permission for my stared contacts to be able to message or call, yet my phone never chimes or vibrates when it's on and those people try to contact me. For my alarm routine I'm trying to make it so it tells the weather for the day, then plays one of my playlists from YouTube music app. I had no issues with either of these topics on my last phone which is a Pixel 2. I also find the Bluetooth extremely slow to discover devices, connect to new ones, and it won't discover my Bluetooth ear phones even though other devices not previously connected to them have no issues finding them.

Any help is greatly appreciated as I'm regretting buying this phone since I'm sick of having to troubleshoot it.
category: Google Assistant and Voice Actions, Google Pixel 4a (5G)

title: Routines get stuck, "for that you'll have to unlock.." and "sorry i didn't understand"
content:
For a long time now routines haven't worked properly. 

1. E.g. Good morning routine ends with "for that you'll have to unlock your device" and after unlocking i just get "sorry i didn't understand". And this despite it's really done everything already. 

2. Trying to make a routine that turns a smart plug on, gives me information on this and that and after that plays the radio on my chromecast, it just gets stuck to trying to send the command to play the radio, but nothing happens. If i send the command using my voice, there's no problem. 

3. This appears with voice commands. Very often the assistant just gets stuck in "please wait" and just gives up after a while. Then if i don't wait and say it again, it won't bring the assistant view on the display, but still does the command in the background. 

It just generally works very poorly. It seems there have been times when it has worked, then an update breaks it for half a year, then something gets updated and perhaps a part of it functions again or for a while and then it's broken again. Very unreliable, unsatisfying and often unusable. Is there really any fix or is the whole system just so poorly designed that it will never work properly?

title: The top speaker crackling at low frequencies. Pixel 4a
content:
This is only noticeable at a certain low frequency. I don't know which one. 

If you turn on a regular track without amplifying the bass, then everything is fine. Normal trap without software bass processing. 
But if some smart guy decided to twist a certain frequency, then the crackling is audible.

Please google find out what the frequency is and fix it. I understand that the device costs 350 dollars, but that's a lot of money in Russia.

I also found an interesting bug when I tested and wrote this appeal: When a track is played entirely consisting of low frequency bass. The top speaker seems to compress the bass, but that's not the point. The main thing is that at the moment the screen flips, the upper speaker hangs for a microsecond and crackles.

The main thing is to fix the crackle problem. I don't care about bass.
category: Google Assistant and Voice Actions, Google Pixel 4a

content:

Then I'll use the voice control button on the car (or I'll say "hey Google") to activate Google assistant and give a voice command "play X on Spotify"

The same issue happens when connected to a bluetooth speaker

I've already contacted Spotify and tried everything such as clean reinstall, changing permissions and changing settings to absolutely no joy.
I tried using SIRI on an iPhone and it worked perfectly so have narrowed it down to an assistant problem.

Any advice?
Thanks in advance

title: Google Assistant will not play songs on Spotify
content:
My Google Assistant will also play certain things on Spotify when asked. Using voice commands or typing commands the assistant will open and play Artists for example if I give the command to play *artist* it will jump to and start playing the Spotify "This is *artist*" playlist without any problems. 

The problem occurs if I ask the assistant to play a specific song, playlist and artist. It will pause the current track or open Spotify if it was not already open but does not begin playing the song. 

The assistant is understanding the command and has picked up the correct spelling in every case and even fills in the blanks for me so I am not entirely sure why it will not work.

I have checked the permissions given to the assistant, the Spotify account is linked and set as the default music application. I have also tried unlinking the Spotify account and linking it again.

I'm not sure what else is best be to try but I've just upgraded from the Pixel 2 and it was working flawlessly on there.

title: "Turn off my tv" doesn't work on Pixel5
content:
https://support.google.com/chromecast/answer/7498991 indicates that users should be able to use the phrase "Turn off the tv" or "Turn off living room tv" to signal the Chromecast Ultra (in my case) to issues CEC power commands to my TV.

Works perfectly on my Pixel 2.
Fails completely with my Pixel 5. The assistant's response is "Sorry, I don't understand."

Google Home App version = 2.30.1.17 on both devices.
Google App version = 11.34.7.23.arm64 on Pixel2 and 11.34.7.29.arm64 on Pixel5.
Android build = RP1A.201005.004 on Pixel2 and RD1A.200810.021.A1 on Pixel5.

I've tried contacting Google Support but none of the teams know who is responsible and I gave up after 10+ agents and ~ 2 hours.

Surely the Pixel5 doesn't ship with a less capable assistant than my ageing Pixel2?

title: No speech output over bluetooth from Assistant after latest Android 11/Google update
content:
When my phone is connected to my car head unit with bluetooth, I am able to launch the assistant by holding the hands free voice button on my steering wheel. Before Android 11, this would work flawlessly and I could hear assistant voice output. Since updating to Android 11, I am still able to launch the assistant with the button, but I no longer hear any voice. I only hear the chime to prompt me to speak a command.

I have since performed a factory reset, and while my phone was setting up and updating all the apps, the function worked and I could hear the assistant. But as soon as my phone was finished setting up and the Google app fully updated, the problem came back.

title: Placing a phone call using Google assistant on android auto
content:
When attempting to make a call using Google assistant on android auto, I lose all Android auto audio. The call is placed, and the far end can hear me, but I can not hear the far end. If I hang up the call, the media audio does not return. The only remedy I've found to this so far is physically disconnecting my phone from the head unit and reconnecting. If I disconnect the phone from the head unit during a call, the audio will suddenly return (as calls are always made over bluetooth, while media audio uses the USB connection). If I place a call by manually pulling up my phone book on the android auto screen, it works without issue. Something about Google Assistant is messing up this audio routing handshake. This happened only intermittently months ago, but now occurs every time.
I am using a Pixel 4 with a Pioneer AVH-4200NEX head unit. The head unit is running the latest firmware.
category: Google Assistant and Voice Actions, Google Pixel 4

title: Android 11 on Pixel 4 has a bug that impairs launch of Assistant
content: I have a Pixel 4 and recently upgraded to Android 11. It turns out Android 11 has a bug on the Pixel 4 and once you upgrade the OS you can no longer launch the Assistant by voice. The Google Assistant will instead keep saying "can't reach Google at the moment". I have tried every normal fix and have tried a session with Google Help chat including a factory reset. The problem only occurs when starting the Assistant via voice. However, when I click in the search field in the Google app and then ask for a search via voice, it works fine. So the problem is in the handoff from saying OK Google to getting the Assistant to listen and respond. You might say this is Not OK Google! And it’s not the account, as the same account on my older Pixel with Android 10 is fine, so it’s only after upgrading to Android 11 on the Pixel 4 that I’ve had this issue. So I’m 99% sure there’s a bug that Google needs to patch here. This should be elevated to the respective device and product teams ASAP. I'm an executive in the wireless business, so I'm not an alarmist or confused consumer, I'm pretty sure of this information for the reasons stated.
category: Google Assistant and Voice Actions, Google Pixel 4

title: Alarm routine misbehaves after Android 11 update.
content:
I am one of the people who ran into all sorts of trouble after the recent update to Android 11. The biggest issue is with the touchscreen that is oversensitive now and results in a million of fathom presses per minute. That aside, I just noticed another quirky thing today. 
In the morning, when the alarm goes off, it automatically triggers a routine of providing details on the day's tasks, weather, and alike, and then it starts playing news. All worked fine until the update. Today, the routine started as usual, but when it came to news, the management window for it (pause, fast forward, etc) just didn't appear in the notification area at all! There it was, Google Assistant's voice reading news with no possibility whatsoever to control it. I have around 30 news sources going that way, which results in literally hours of news, and usually I just stop 15-25 minutes into it from the above-mentioned management panel in the notification area. As the window seems missing now, I just had to restart the phone to shut up those news. Anyone else with the same issue?

P.S. General afterthought on the update. I found myself to be a die-hard fan of clean Android and Google recently, and I've been recommending all my friends to switch to Android. Now this update came, and it has so many bugs that frankly left me shocked. It feels like a throwback into nightmares of 2010s, when Android on third-manufacturer devices was so buggy it was barely usable.  Clean Android is awesome for everyday use, but I only now realized it's the first major update I received since my romance with Google's devices. And no, it's no better than those old days when an update would introduce more bugs than good features. Really, Google? You disappointed me so much that I started to think about switching to iPhone instead - and that comes from a person who is never ever said one good word about Apple in her entire life. Heck, I was given a free iPhone X twice in the last 6 months, and both times I ended up giving it up after 2 weeks and buying Pixels (3a and now 4a) instead. 
Yeah, I know Google is going to fix these bugs soon, but just the general attitude of pushing an update that is half-baked and making customers struggle for several days is what makes me think about my choice of phones for the future. With Apple, I won't enjoy the simplicity and customization Android has to offer, but I won't struggle after each update either. If the entire selling point of Pixels is just how simpler they make our lives, then sorry, it ain't it.
category: Google Assistant and Voice Actions, Google Pixel 4a

title: Pixel 4 XL not responding to 'OK Google' when idle for a while
content:
My Pixel 4 XL has stopped responding to 'OK/Hey Google' commands when it's been left idle for a while.  The only way to get it to start responding again is to manually start the Assistant (either edge squeeze or hitting the Assistant button on the right of the search bar at the bottom of the screen).  Once that's been done it works fine again for a while until the phone has been idle again.

I've tried the following:

Clear cache and data
Uninstall and reinstall Google app
Delete and retrain Voice Match
Reset all settings in the app toggles
Checked battery saver (although the phone does it regardless of charge level)

I don't think it's a hardware issue as once the Assistant is manually 'woken' it works fine again for some time.  None of my other devices have any issues (I have 3 Google Home Max and a Sony Android TV) so it's not a Voice Match issue.  It also used to work fine until recently (probably within the last couple of weeks).

It's almost as though the phone just 'stops listening' for the OK/Hey Google wake words while it's idling on the AOD.  Is anyone else encountering this?  Google support tried to help but other than getting me to do the above I don't think they have any other ideas; I was hoping to find out whether it's just me or others are having this issue too.
category: Google Assistant and Voice Actions, Google Pixel 4 XL

title: Assistant and Pixel Ambient Services conflicting
content:
Enabling Assistant and Pixel Ambient Services (hereto as PAS) creates a conflict in which Assistant can't use the mic properly.

With PAS enabled, Assistant will still ALWAYS respond to "Okay Google". However, once the tray opens, Assistant briefly hangs while waiting for the "What's playing?" suggested action button to be sent over from PAS.

It appears that in that interval, Assistant is prevented from activating the mic properly, so it never "hears" my command and after the "no command" timeout interval elapses, and the app will just default to the generic "There's a lot I can help with" screen.

This issue occurs 100% of the time if the screen is already off (I use swipe to unlock). Issue is intermittent if the screen is already on and seems related to whether there's enough ambient audio nearby that PAS is actively attempting to identify it (even if that ambience is just noise).

ALL above symptoms are alleviated as soon as PAS is disabled.
ALL above symptoms immediately reappear if PAS is re-enabled.
NONE of the settings found under "Settings > Google Assistant > Assistant tab > Assistant Devices > [phone]" affect this issue to any degree and all above symptoms stay constant with any combination of settings.
ALL apps on my phone have their most recent Play Store updates as of today, June 15.
I performed all suggested "support" steps from Google, which amounted to just clearing and re-downloading my voice model. They seemed completely unaware of the conflict between these two apps.
Device is only 72 hours old, so this isn't a "factory reset to fix" kind of thing.

It would appear that I'm at the point that in order to use PAS alongside Assistant, Google's engineers need to fix the former app.
category: Google Assistant and Voice Actions, Google Pixel 3a

title: New Google Assistant doesn't reroute destinations in Maps via voice command
content:
I've had this issue since February and contacting support has gone nowhere.  Basically the issue is this

1) Start a route with google maps
2) Use a voice command to try to change your destination
3) Assistant confirms that the route is changed but the route isn't actually changed.

It has to do with the new assistant.  If I add a language pack where the new assistant isn't supported it works just fine.  If I minimize google maps, the voice command works fine and will actually ask if I want to end navigation before I start the new route.

Google support has just said they would send it up the line and asked me to send feedback via the google maps app and google assistant app.  The issue still persists and I'm able to reproduce it on a freshly factory reset Pixel 4 and on other Pixel 4s.

title: Проблема с Google Assistant
content:
Добрый день.

Не поможете разобраться с пооблемой Гугл-ассистента на телефоне Google Pixel 3a.

С недавних пор, примерно как месяц, после одного из обновлений при вызове ассистента при заблокированном экране фразой окей, гугл - он включается и тут же зависает. Якобы ждет моего запроса, но пиктограма, которая появляется вместо микрофона статично висит. После чего ассистент переходит в меню типовых запросов, думая, что я молчал.

При повторном вызове ассистента он нормально воспринимает речь и начинает поиск.

Пробовал делать сброс к заводским настройкам - проблема вернулась на следующий день.
При использовании active edge так же отрабатывает без ошибок.

Проблема наблюдается только при вызове ассистента фразой и только в момент, когда телефон заблокирован.


Так же, если вам это чем-то поможет, если запустить с заблокированного экрана ассистента, например через active edge и задать поисковой запрос, то ассистент пусть и отработает но первые 5-6 секунд не слышно, что он проговаривает. Звук включается через указанное время и, если ассистент выдает длинное предложение, ты слышишь его концовку.

Телефон: Google Pixel 3a
Последняя версия ос, последняя версия приложения, все автоматически обновляется.


С уважением,
Леонид
category: Google Assistant and Voice Actions, Google Pixel 3a

title: Pixel 3XL Android Auto can't hear voice commands after "OK Google"
content:
Audi MMI 3G (2014):  I connect via bluetooth as a handsfree AND media source, Android Auto launches automatically, I say "OK Google" and the four-color drop-down appears, but then it can't hear subsequent commands from me.  the drop-down then displays "Try saying 'what can you do'?" for a while then gives up while I yell anything at it.  What is going on?

For reference, same procedure above using an Xperia XZ2 running Pie and latest Android Auto works perfectly fine - hears commands and plays on car speakers set to bluetooth media.

I have tested Android Auto on the Pixel 3XL on other bluetooth headsets and voice commands work fine, though audio comes through in much poorer quality than the music - maybe that's the age of my bluetooth speakers? Or Pixel 3XL Android Auto is using some other profile?

So the Pixel 3 is doing something strange via bluetooth and android auto.  Another thread pointed to being able to turn off HD for certain connections in Oreo, but those options aren't in Pie anymore.

Just using the Google Assistant normally via bluetooth outside Android Auto is a bit buggy - it takes two squeezes to get it to listen to me, but when it does hear me it responds via the car speakers.

What is going on?

I am not an expert in Bluetooth profiles, but it feels like once you say OK Google it is switching to handsfree profile but the car mic is not active.  These are older bluetooth head units that have separate phone and media profiles.

How come Sony has figured this out?

Is there an app that lets me control individual bluetooth pairing audio quality?
category: Google Assistant and Voice Actions, Google Pixel 3 XL

title: Pixel 4, Assistant No longer works.
content:
Chaps,

title: Headphones cause Volume up/down + mic press + ok google - replaced headphone jack and didn't fix?
content:
Im having a interesting issue. Having a earbud headphone plugged in with a microphone on it results in the volume (most often) going down to mute automatically, sometimes up.....and with the ok google / google assistant being throttle triggered. This behavior persists with the phone screen off and with various permissions removed.
This issue is not the result of dirty or malfunctioning headphones and doesn't appear to be a faulty headphone jack either. Headphones work perfectly fine in mulitple phones including my wife's identical original pixel running the same exact OS version (android 10). I also tested with multiple different branded headphones all have caused the same issue. I went and grabbed a non-mic 99 cent pair of headphones (harder and harder to find) and the issue does not persist.

I ordered a replacement headphone jack that appeared brand new (ebay purchase) and replaced it and thought that would be the end of my problems. The issue persisted after replacing with a new jack.
Since I replaced the jack, as well as tested multiple headphones and confirmed the issue does not exist with a non-mic headphone, this must mean that there is some software confliction going on that is driving my phone crazy due to mic input.

I have spent the last week googling various situations (faulty headset, ok google randomly occuring, volume up/down during audio playback, etc) and tried a dozen + different solutions.
If I remove microphone permission from the "google" it does not resolve the issue. It does prevent me from using voice to text however, which to me is a essential function of the phone. This part confuses me. There must be a separate permission that handles the microphone through the headphone. I've looked up the various ways to disable the "ok google" function but none of them appear to stop the behavior.

Here are some screenshots showing exactly how annoying this issue is -
https://imgur.com/a/xwOayZU

The first two images are examples of what happens when I deny google microphone permissions. Instead of just blocking it, it just constantly nags me to enable permissions but not only does it nag in the notification pull down it also nags with audio....so it is impossible to listen to music. I installed volume lock to prevent audio volume from being changed thinking I was being smart, only to find out that the constant ok google nag interrupts the audio.

The 3rd image is what happens if I disable voice assistant from google > settings > assistant tab > assistant device (pixel)

It still does the same thing, except instead of giving me the standard ok google response it just pops it up and asks for me to enable permission. Such a worthless feature (permission management) if the same exact problem occurs when you refuse to give it permissions.

If anyone has any idea's for me to try, please advise, I've spent weeks on this now and im completely out of idea's. I love the phone. I love my headjack port. I don't want a new phone....I can replace this phone's screen for $25 if I break it, parts are dirt cheap and its a easy phone to repair. It works great and serves all my purposes and runs the latest android OS to boot.
category: Google Assistant and Voice Actions, Google Pixel

title: My pixel 2 died on Fri Jan 10. Google can't get their tool to generate RMA for my replacement
content:
Last Friday my pixel 2 died. I called google support and they walked me thru the recovery and agreed that it was dead and under warranty and that they would replace it. The rep said that I would receive an email to start the process. an hour later I didn't have the email I called and spent another hour on the phone with their support. To summarize, I have called google every day since last Friday, luckily I still have a land line to call them with. I have spoken with very nice operators who tell me that their tool that generates the RMA to email me a return label is failing when they try to enter my information. They tell me that the case has been escalated and that it is "assigned". Somehow after 7 days of an escalated issue with their software tool, they can't fix it nor can they provide an explanation nor can they figure out an alternate way to honor their warranty and get me a replacement phone. Additionally, every night the support person promises to send me an email status (after asking for my mobile number, duh! my phone is dead) and I have yet to receive any information from google. Does anyone know what I can do next? Obviously the path that google provides for getting a phone replaced under warranty is not working, but I can't find any other google contact to solve this problem. I am now in day 8 of no phone with no solution in sight. My previous pixel had died just after the warranty period but since I liked the pixel and my friends had pixel2 I decided to give google another chance. I feel pretty dumb for making that decision. I like my pixel 2 but my experience with google support is awful and I would be a fool to purchase another pixel from a company that doesn't honor the warranty. 
If anyone knows a different way for me to contact google to reach someone who can think outside of the box and get my replacement in the mail whole the company works on their software tool for generating RMA labels, PLEASE PROVIDE IT. I don't know what else to do and I am not ready to just buy a new phone and not hold google to their warranty.
category: Google Assistant and Voice Actions, Google Pixel 2

For the record, here are the steps to my problem:
1. Squeeze phone to bring up Google Assistant
2. Say "Call Jane Doe"
3. Google Assistant does a Google Search for "call Jane Doe" instead of actually calling Jane Doe from my contacts.

title: Disable 'Enable Voice Match' prompt permanently
content:
I want to disable the pop-up screen which asks me to enable voice match. I have two Google Home devices and I got sick and tired of my device unlocking every time I wanted to turn on my lights. My solution? Turn off Voice Match and turn off 'Okay Google' on my Pixel.

To my demise, no matter where I'm at on my phone, the words "Hey Google" will bring up the enable voice match prompt. Why doesn't this remember my selection? Does Google think I am stupid for saying no? This is completely ridiculous why I can't say no to a feature I absolutely do not want.

title: How can I use my phone handsfree while driving when voice unlock has been restricted?

But…

This is a problem when driving, because here in the UK, we are not permitted to touch our phone at all while at the wheel. So, for example, when stuck in a major traffic jam, I can't telephone my destination to let them know that I'll be late.

So…

How can I make calls and open apps (such as Waze) hands-free while driving?

Thanks

title: Earbud middle button always triggers audio news now?
content:
I have a Google Pixel 3 and sometimes listen to news by saying "OK Google, tell me the latest news."  After I'm done with the news I usually just close the Google app (that was playing news), and continue to do other things while listening to ebooks in the @Voice Aloud Reader app. The earbuds' middle button can be used to pause and resume the ebook when I need to. Very convenient.

Recently I paired the phone with a new pair of Google 3 earbuds (my original pair was broken), and after the setup I found that the earbud buttons can be used to control Google Assistant. For example when new notifications come in, I can press the top button to listen to the notification, without taking the phone out of my pocket, which is very cool.

But then I bump into another problem: nowadays when I listen to ebooks in the @Voice Aloud Reader app, and press the middle button to pause the ebook, next time I press the middle button the ebook doesn't resume, instead the audio news starts playing. This often forces me to stop whatever I'm doing, take the phone out of the pocket, and manually close the Google app, to resume the ebook.

Is there an easy way to make the middle button only pause/resume the ebook in @Voice,  instead of always triggering the audio news? Or do I have to completely turn off the earbuds control with Google Assistant, to get back the convenience to pause/resume ebooks in @Voice with the middle button?

title: Bug or Feature? Assistant triggers when I take pixel 2 xl out of my pocket even w/ max sqz setting
content:
I recently got a new Pixel 2XL under warranty. This new phone triggers Google assistant whenever I take the phone out from my pocket. I have been experimenting and observing this for a week now. I'm talking hours of obsession - including factory resets to experiment with fresh settings. I can (95% or more often) reproduce the problem with no fingerprints (to ensure I'm not accidentally hitting that sensor - but the problem exists with or without fingerprints) and Squeeze sensitivity at the max - but doesn't matter what the sensitivity is.

With the phone on and screen unlocked*, I can turn the phone off, turn it upside down, rest the top edge on of the now upside down phone on a table, with the back of the phone resting on my index finger (far away from the fingerprint sensor) and wait some time for the ambient display to turn off - basically simulating the phone being in my pocket. When the ambient display turns off, I gently hold the phone so as not to trigger the Active Edge, lift the phone up and hold it flat like you would when taking it our of the pocket. When the display turns on the Google assistant pops up.

Also, I am pretty sure this issue has something to do with the Always on ambient display, because if you turn it off in settings, then the screen won't wake when you take the phone out of your pocket and the assistant won't appear. If you do have ambient display on, simply picking it up from the table when it is "ambient" on will not trigger the assistant. It has to come out of your pocket - or simulated pocket as per above.

Lastly, prior to breaking my old phone I know I turned off Ambient display and did not use it the past year because at the time i did not like it. When I got this new one I thought I'd give it a try. So that is why ran into this issue.

*"the phone on and screen unlocked" --- during my "testing" I noticed that if I did not start from this state, I could not reliably reproduce the problem. For example if the phone was off and flat on the table with the ambient display on, sometimes when I rested the top edge on the table to simulate being in my pocket and then lifted it, i could not trigger the assistant . . . but sometimes I could . So, i don't really know what the exact initial states needs to be to get assistant to trigger - it happens to me 95% or more of the time and I know I'm not accidentally triggering active edge.

-------------
:-) And if you read this far you probably think I'm crazy. Oh well, I hope someone can reproduce this issue too. If not then I'd have to guess my new phone is broken and send it back.again.
category: Google Assistant and Voice Actions, Google Pixel 2

title: Why does Google Play Music not play the requested song when using Google Assistant?
content:
My Pixel 2 XL sits in a car mount when I'm driving and is connected to my car's stereo via aux cable (and USB-C adapter).

A few weeks ago I started to notice that when I told it to play a song, it would find that song in GPM, but wouldn't play it.

So for example, I say, "Hey Google, play Piano Man by Billy Joel."
It'll respond with, "OK, Piano Man by Billy Joel, here it is on Google Play Music."

Then I look at the phone and the lockscreen widget for GPM has the correct song queued up, but it won't start playing. If I press the Play button manually then it'll play, but otherwise it won't ever start on its own.

I've looked through settings but cannot for the life of me find anything that is stopping music from playing. Has anyone experienced this before?

It's happening on Android 10, but also happened on Pie. The phone is completely stock with no root or mods.

title: How to change default navigation app in Android and Google assistant
content:
I'm simply trying to have Android open links to directions in citymapper Google assistant open citymapper when I ask it to take me somewhere. I have searched everywhere and found that in 2016 people were having the reverse problem: https://www.google.com/amp/s/amp.reddit.com/r/GooglePixel/comments/58u8lq/how_do_you_control_the_default_apps_google/


I also found an article by Google: https://support.google.com/waze/answer/6291190?hl=en detailing the process for getting Waze as the default. I have tried the steps in this article for citymapper and they did not work. 

Currently I have maps set as "do not open supported" links under my phone settings, and this at least allows me to choose citymapper when I open a link for directions in other apps - for example, in Yelp. 

I was wondering how I would:
1) Set citymapper as my default navigation app so I don't have to keep selecting it in apps like Yelp when I want directions

2) Set citymapper as my default for Google assistant

I'm not sure if this is an issue with citymapper, my own incompetence, or with Android/Google refusing to let competing apps be the default (I really hope it isn't this one) but any help would be greatly appreciated!

title: Odd Issue With Assistant & Calendar Events
content:
I found a strange issue that seems be specific to mine & my wife's phones (both P3XL's) and was wondering if others are experiencing the same.

Typical scenario: 
Create an event in Google Calendar for XYZ day on a Chromebook, Win 10 machine or Android tablet. 
On P3XL, activate Assistant and ask "what's on my calendar for XYZ day?" 

Assistant responds: "here are the events you requested", and lists every event twice. After scrolling to the bottom and clicking "Show full agenda", events are only listed once. This also happens in Android Auto with a connected screen: when given the Assistant command: "what's on my calendar for XYZ day?", all events will be spoken twice. (So irritating!)

None of the events are listed twice in Google Calendar whether on the phone, a Chomebook or the web page; only on the phone when prompted through Assistant. All devices are logged into the same account. Other devices in the home (4 Home Hubs and 2 Mini's) do not exhibit this behavior.

I have tried clearing app cache & storage in Google Calendar and Assistant, uninstalling and re-installing; making sure not to restore app data and the issue still persists. 

Is anyone else experiencing the same behavior?
category: Google Assistant and Voice Actions, Google Pixel 3 XL

title: I cannot cancel the Google Assistant reminders.
content:
Pixel 2 XL

A couple of days ago, I asked Google Assistant, "Hey Google, remind me to [task] at 11 o'clock tomorrow." I later added a second reminder for a different task.

The next day, Google reminded me on my phone at the right times, which was great.

However, since then, Google keeps on reminding me. It happens without fail every time when I restart the phone, and at arbitrary other times. The notification shows both of my old reminders. (See the attached screenshot of my notification.)

Here is what I've tried.

Tap the notification, which opens the Google Assistant and shows me that there are no reminders.
Press "Done" on the notification, which closes the notification.
Swipe the notification away.
As already mentioned, restart the phone (several times already).

But still, I keep getting reminders.

How do I cancel these old reminders, please?
